newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Creative slides in New York.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Creative slides in New York.

text.p: American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) in Singapore software company Creative Technology Ltd slid on Friday, hit by a ratings downgrade.

Creative ADRs were down 1-11/16 to 12-1/2 in heavy trade after Schroder Securities rated the stock avoid, saying Creative's earnings would be hurt by the launch of competing media processors from Cyrix Corp. The report called Creative's prospects "extremely uncertain."
Cambridge SoundWorks Inc also said Creative was buying a 19.5 percent stake in the company. Cambridge shares were up 1/2 to 5-5/8 after the announcement.
Creative's volume was 3.1 million shares traded by early afternoon, more than double the average daily level and putting Creative at the top of the ADRs' most-active list.
South Korean shares slid on the prospect of higher interest rates and fears of worse-than-expected earnings from blue chip Korea Mobile Telecom Corp, traders said.
"They are coming down across the board," a trader said.
Korea Mobile was down 7/8 to 13, Pohang Iron & Steel Co Ltd fell 3/4 to 19-5/8 and Korean Investment Fund Inc was off 1/4 to 7-5/8.
Canadian gold mining companies Placer Dome Inc and Barrick Gold Corp followed the price of gold higher. Placer was up 1/2 to 22-3/8 and Barrick rose 3/8 to 27-1/4.
Among Latin American ADRs, Telefonos de Mexico was unchanged at 39-7/8.
Decliners barely led advancers by 253 to 252 among 807 ADRs. Volume was 52 million shares.
